snippet: The automaker missed an April 3 deadline to answer questions from the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration about why it did not recall cars until years after learning of safety problems.
abstract: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration fines General Motors $28,000, saying it had not provided information requested for investigation into recall of 2.6 million cars with ignition switch defect linked to 13 deaths.
lead_paragraph: The automaker missed an April 3 deadline to answer questions from the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration about why it did not recall cars until years after learning of safety problems.

headline.main: U.S. Fines General Motors $28,000 for Not Cooperating With Ignition Flaw Inquiry
headline.print_headline: U.S. Fines General Motors $28,000 for Not Cooperating With Ignition Flaw Inquiry
